com.eightsines.holycycle

Class ViewControllerFragmentDelegate

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eightsines.holycycle.ViewControllerFragmentDelegate

  • public class ViewControllerFragmentDelegate
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class which transform Android-lifecycle to ViewController-lifecycle.

    If you can't use ViewControllerFragment or ViewControllerPlatformFragment, (eg. you can't change base fragment for some reason), use this class. See ViewControllerFragment for example of usage - it is pretty simple.

    • Constructor Summary

      View controller delegate constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ViewControllerFragmentDelegate

        public ViewControllerFragmentDelegate(@NonNull
                                      ViewController controller)
        View controller delegate constructor. Mostly you want use it like new ViewControllerFragmentDelegate(this), however it is possible to separate host fragment from the view controller.

        See the ViewControllerFragment for an example of use.

        Parameters:
        controller - Managed view controller.

      • getView

        @Nullable
public android.view.View getView()
        Pass return value from this method to ViewController.getView().

        This method makes sense only for platform fragments (android.app.Fragment), because there is no onViewCreated callback on API lower than 13, and this class emulate it (see onCreateView(LayoutInflater inflater, ViewGroup container, boolean isPlatformFragment)). To ensure that ViewController.onControllerContentViewCreated() can use ViewController.getView() and ViewController.findViewById(int id), custom getView() method must be used.

        Returns:
        The content view or null.

      • findViewById

        @Nullable
public <T extends android.view.View> T findViewById(int id)
        Pass return value from this method to ViewController.findViewById(int id).
        Parameters:
        id - Pass id parameter here.
        Returns:
        A view with given ID if found, or null otherwise.
